# Task

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example



# Special Instructions

{{instructions}}

Here is a function to wrap text to a certain width:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::AbstractString, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = ""
        end
        
        if isempty(line)
            line = word
        else
            line = line * " " * word
        end
    end
    
    push!(lines, line)
    return join(lines, "\n") 
end

```

This iterates through the words, keeping track of the current line length. If adding the next word would exceed the text width, it starts a new line. 

Example usage:

```julia
text = "This is some sample text that will be wrapped"

print(wrap_string(text))
```
